intro: Delphinium chungbaense, commonly known as the Chungbae delphinium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet and neighboring regions. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its foliage consists of palmately compound leaves, and it produces elongated seed pods that contain numerous small, dark seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
